creator: giovanni.pertici

title: Self-hosted add-on install is broken on Firefox 100.0 and 101 beta
content:
Hello! We distribute Firefox add-ons on PC and macOS outside of Mozilla store.

Until Firefox 100.0 our users were able to install the add-on by clicking a button on the product side which was opening a link to XPI file hosted on our company's download server. That was triggering a usual install dialog from Firefox where it asks user to confirm the installation.

Starting from Firefox 100.0 this stopped happening and we started receiving numerous support calls from our customers about not being able to install the add-on. The issue now is that when the XPI link is opened in Firefox, the install dialog does not appear which brings a lot of confusion to the user. Firefox shows the link to the XPI in the address bar but does not start the usual install process (attaching screenshot of how it looks like on my Mac). The issue applies to both macOS and Windows platforms. I've opened a bug case on bugzilla. The link for reference: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1766965

Could someone please clarify how we should proceed with this issue? We are now getting reports of this issue from many of our customers. Thank you.
creator: artur.valiev

title: Importing old firefox stored passwords to new account
content:
Hi folks, I'm having trouble with importing old firefox stored passwords to new account. I got all the old data (logins.json, key3, key4,...)

I tried copying the logins.json and key3/key4.dbf file into the firebird profile root directory but they dont seem to load. It doesn't show anything no matter if I'm logged into a firebird account or not.

Since the old files are only a week old I'm guessing I shouldn't need to convert files.

When I convert logins.json file to csv I see the info is there.

What's the catch?

title: video doesn't play, but audio does when viewing online training
content:
just updated to version 100, and now my work is stalled because I can't play online training videos (that it's my job to create, so need to publish and preview them online). The audio plays, but the video does not. Interestingly, when I navigate away from the tab, the visual still refreshes to the progress point in the video, but still does not PLAY the video.

I can share this example test link for example: https://360.articulate.com/review/content/e704e58f-e30a-4ddb-9f78-34138c1b5e3e/review

title: pestañas pegadas y normales
content:
SIempre uso una ventana con 5 pestañas pegadas ( facebook , youtube, etc) y varias pestañas que pueden ser de hace un par de meses . con la ultima actualizacion de mozilla sin querer cerre la ventana principal sin darme cuenta que tenia otra ventana abierta minimizada y sin preguntarme nada me cerro la ventana principal ( con unas 20 aproximadamente ) y me dejo la nueva ventana abierta con 6 pestañas . cuando abro una nueva ventana para ver si me aparecian las pestañas pegadas y las otras pestañas , no me aparece nada . 

ahora cada ves que quiero cerra la ventana principal me aparece un mensaje de verificacion de que se me van a cerrar x pestañas donde x es el numero de pestañas no pegadas . Pero si desactivo la opcion de que me avise antes de cerrar varias pestañas corro el riesgo de que me pase lo mismo .

No hay una forma de restaurar una ventana con todo su contenido en caso de que pase eso?

title: Add shortcut icon on Firefox Home Screen
content:
Using Firefox on desktop, Windows 11. I am a long term Firefox fan/user.

My problem is I cannot find anywhere an easy method to add a shortcut on my Home Screen (which has now been a FF feature for some considerable time).

I am sure there was something available to do this in a prior version some time back. If I search the internet, I only come across articles describing how to do it on Firefox Android.

I know I can manually edit a box on the Home Screen to create what I need.

Sometimes new web sites that I visit appear in the boxes and I can then pin them in place - but the behavior around this is very erratic and unreliable - seems like random chance for an icon to appear on the home screen for a newly visited site. If this was more consistent, I could work with that.

BUT - where is the **intuitive** option??!!

I should be able to right-click on a tab and select "Add to Home Screen".

As simple as that.

Or drag and drop a link, or tab to the home screen - but this just opens the link. I have tried everything obvious that I can think of.

Anyone?

Many thanks :)
creator: aufladen

title: Login auto-fill not working on Airbnb.co.nz site
content:
I have saved username and password for airbnb.co.nz. It does not fill in the username box in the login pagehttps://www.airbnb.co.nz/?_set_bev_on_new_domain=1651793110_NDIyMTVlNjdjMDEw https://www.airbnb.co.nz/?_set_bev_on_new_domain=1651793110_NDIyMTVlNjdjMDEw.

Auto-fill works fine for all other sites logins. Google uses similar 2 step login layout, when I click in the username box a list of usernames for google site drops down. This does not happen with Airbnb.

The problem occurs in multiple profiles including a new profile set up to test, all history and cookies cleared. First the browser offers to save the login with username empty. (Manually filled in username then saved.) Then logged out, login page username is empty. Does not autofill even when I start typing the saved username.

What is causing this? Is it happening on the main .com site or just the .co.nz site?. ( I am unable to test the .com site because I am in New Zealand, airbnb.com site redirects automatically to airbnb.co.nz url above) How can I fix it please?
creator: firefox-questions
